name: ITP-093-Rail-CAMMS-Pedestrian Crossing Removal & Spot Tamping
template name: ITP-093-Rail-CAMMS-Pedestrian Crossing Removal & Spot Tamping Rev 0

name: Document Title: ITP-093-Rail-CAMMS-Pedestrian Crossing Removal & Spot Tamping
ITP Description: CAMMS-Pedestrian Crossing Removal & Spot Tamping
ITP approved for use by: Victor Mira
Reference: L1-CHE-SPE-003 Heavy Rail Construction Tolerances
Reference: L1-CHE-STD-039 MTST 000002-01 Track Design and Construction
Reference: PTC Heavy Rail Track Construction Standards Drawing F598
Reference: Camms Road Package 52 Design Drawings
2.01 Obtain and submit Material Certificate of Compliance for Track Materials; Track Jewellery / Ballast 60mm Aggregate
REFERENCE: IFC Drawing, Track Construction Site Mudmap, Bill of Materials
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Units to be free from damage, total and types of units for full set validated No signs of discoloration
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: ConQA Hold Point Release
REFERENCE: Track Construction Site Mudmap, Asphalt Cutting Plan
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Plant to detail cutting pattern for asphalt required for removal.
○ Asphalt to be cut to 150mm depth to provide clearance between cutting disc and concrete sleepers/rail jewellery
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: ConQA Hold Point Release
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: No damage or rust on components
○ Validate total number and type of components matches drawing
3.01 Cut and remove asphalt, Clean track structure of loose asphalt and debris, remove contaminated asphalt as required
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Cut asphalt as per cutting plan, asphalt to be cut at depth of 150mm so as to avoid damage to rail and sleepers.
○ Remove asphalt material, clean debris off rail and ballast, remove contaminated ballast as requried.
RESPONSIBILITY: Track Surveyor, Track Supervisor, Site/Project Engineer
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-STD-039 MTST 000002-01 Track Design and Construction
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All rail sitting within Sleeper footing with correct sleeper insulators
REFERENCE: Track tamping alignment as per existing
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Track Excavator Tamped, Ensures Track Geometry Tolerances are not breached;
○ General Alignment +15/ -15 (note, partial resleeper only requries track to be tamped to conform with local geometry, no survey requirement)
○ A minimum horizontal clearance of 3.0m from track centreline to structure.
○ Height and Stagger readings of overhead wire to ensure minimum clearance of 4.61m is not breached
RESPONSIBILITY: Tamping Operator, Track Surveyor, Overhead Engineer, Track Supervisor, Site/Project Engineer
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-STD-039 MTST 000002-01 Track Design and Construction
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ballast has 400m width from outer edge of kerbstone with 1:5 crossfall thereafter
○ No Ballast to be on top surface of sleepers or aorund rail Fastenings
– Rubber Panels free of ballast materials
RESPONSIBILITY: Regulator Operator, Works Supervisor, Site/Project Engineer
REFERENCE: MTMF020000-1 – Track Form A T, MTMF020000-2 – Track Form B
FREQUENCY: Once when all occupation works complete
RESPONSIBILITY: Nominated Authority (MTM Infrastructure Track Certifier)
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: ConQA Hold Point Release

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
